1.title: Happy Holidays, You Bastard
1.plot: It's Christmas time but all is not well. With the gang all split up from the aftermath of Season 2, it's up to three Ghosts to try and show the reprehensible Skull the error of his ways and convince him to bring everyone back together again.

2.title: Jingle Hell
2.plot: Skull has had some shocking revelations about how his friends were hurting after the results of Season 2, but the precocious Ghost of Christmas Past isn't done with him yet.

3.title: Forget December
3.plot: After the eye opening visit from his first Ghost, Skull decides to take matters into his own hands and cheer up Ginge - by getting him drunk and laid, despite Ginge's protests. Whilst out though Skull is intervened by his second Ghost.

4.title: Fools Holiday
4.plot: With Karly attempting to help Ginge move on, Bones finds herself at a crossroads between what the body wants and what the heart needs.

5.title: Christmas Mourning
5.plot: Two Ghosts down and Skull is feeling less than enthused about meeting the third and final one, but nothing can prepare him for the Ghost of Christmas Future.

6.title: The End of the Road
6.plot: With the bleak image of Skull's future now shown, has he left it too late to make amends, and have his friends parted ways forever?

1.title: Intervention
1.plot: The group hit the bar for a night of banter, though it's mostly dominated by the guys acting like typical guys to the girls disgust. Ginge drops a few unsubtle hints about Beki and Tails obvious attraction to each other but failure to do anything about it, much to their mutual annoyance. But both Ginge and Beki are distracted by new interests, and the clock begins to tick on both Ginge and Tails becoming the person they each need to be, or watching their chance at happiness leave.

2.title: Party Hard
2.plot: The guys are having a party! Though there is a good chance Ginge is just using it as an excuse to invite Chloe, the girl he met at the bar and hasn't been able to stop thinking about. She turns up and spends the night destroying his advances with a roll of her eyes and a grin on her face. Ginge is in for some hard truths about his past and will have to realize just how much he's going to have to prove himself to her. In the meantime Beki tries to instill some courage into Tails to admit her feelings and realize that what she wants isn't out of reach, she just has to ...

3.title: Nookie
3.plot: The party continues on, Ginge has been knocked down but isn't giving up yet as he is determined to confront Chloe as to why she is so repulsed by him. It's a bit of a reality check for him, but one he needs to hear if he's going to ever grow as a person. Tails is feeling deflated by yet again failing to take the hint from Beki and instead pushing her into the attentions of someone else, so she tries to take Ginge's advice on being confident and arrogant to chat up other girls, what could possibly go wrong?

4.title: Girls, Girls, Girls
4.plot: The guys are out on a night of debauchery, at least that's what Skull is hoping for, however as his usual attempts at chatting up girls have utterly disastrous results, Ginge decides it's time to try and teach Tails the appropriate way to engage a girl in conversation at a bar. She has to be better than Skull, right?

5.title: Dude Looks Like a Lady
5.plot: As the night continues on at the bar Tails has successfully managed to chat up a girl and buy her a drink without completely making a fool of herself! There's only one thing she's forgetting... Chloe arrives for a night out and is instantly approached by Ginge, however the smile on her faces tells that she is starting to enjoy their little encounters, mostly as she comes off far wittier than he can ever be. She still doesn't trust him though, especially as he was just at the bar talking to a girl, and so it looks like the night is a failure for nearly everyone.

6.title: Redefine
6.plot: Ginge is suffering from dreams that terrify him worse than nightmares, as he and Chloe are beginning to blossom into a romance he remembers why it is he has spent so long avoiding relationships. Tails is horribly hungover and forced to admit why it is she is so scared to make a move on Beki, and so they both must reflect on whether or not the past is doomed to repeat itself.

7.title: Make a Move
7.plot: This is it, the night of revelations! Will Chloe decide to overlook Ginge's checkered past with girls in order to start dating him, or will she offer him instead the hand of friendship so that he can build up her trust in him as a person? Will Tails finally realize that Beki is right there waiting for her and make that move, or has she long since realized that the risk of losing a great friendship for a possibly good relationship is just far too great, and be happy for her with someone else?

1.title: Creeping Death
1.plot: The alternative crowd are back! Beki and Tails, Ginge and Chloe are now couples giving the relationship malarky a shot and to celebrate they've gone off to a festival! It's the last few day though and only a few campers remain, partying it up before heading home the next day. Only things take a bit of an unexpected turn, leaving the gang lost and alone in the woods, with no hope, no idea and no 4G...

2.title: Calling All Skeletons
2.plot: Party time at the flat, and even better it's fancy dress! With Skull and Ry being the only singles out of the group surely this means that this party will go a hell of a lot smoother than the last one...

3.title: The Crow & the Butterfly
3.plot: The problem when all your friends are in relationships is that you're often the 3rd or 5th wheel, no more so than in Skull's case as a night out starts to hit home that he really is alone in the group. That is until Bones arrives, and you always want what you can't have.

4.title: Haunting Me
4.plot: The 'honeymoon' phase is starting to fade and now the insecurities are creeping in. Tails, already notoriously lacking in confidence, begins to feel the lack of attention from Beki who prefers to avoid conflict. Whereas Ginge is beginning to feel the frustrations of dating a girl who doesn't remotely trust you.

5.title: All the Small Things
5.plot: Patience is a virtue, whatever the hell a virtue is, but it's definitely something the gang don't know either. Ginge, Tails are starting to lose their patience as Chloe and Beki are feeling under pressure.

6.title: The End Is the Beginning Is the End
6.plot: With Ginge and Tails both feeling low after fights with Chloe and Beki they decide to drown their sorrows at the pub, unfortunately Skull is also now feeling pissed off with the lot of them and is branching out his friendship circle. Meanwhile Chloe has a heart to heart with Ry about the future of her relationship with Ginge.

7.title: Tears Into Wine
7.plot: With Ginge and Tails both feeling low after fights with Chloe and Beki they decide to drown their sorrows at the pub, unfortunately Skull is also now feeling pissed off with the lot of them and is branching out his friendship circle. Meanwhile Chloe has a heart to heart with Ry about the future of her relationship with Ginge.

8.title: Separate Ways
8.plot: In the final episode of Season 2, Ginge and Tails must face the consequences of their actions. Has their friendship been forever changed, and can they face Chloe and Beki?

imdb.plot outline: When you're young it's all about the sex, partying and rock and roll but as you get older you learn that there are consequences to everything and hangovers really suck! The alternative crowd have always been met with dirty looks and stereotyped views, but no matter how outrageous they may dress they're just the same as everyone else. They fall in love and they fail in love, they have friendship drama and crappy jobs all the same. The series follows three flatmates and their tag along friend as they try desperately to find that one person they can be happy with whilst dealing with all the obstacles that come before them; social awkwardness, insecurity and a difficulty in letting go of the past.
imdb.title: Metalhedz
plot: Delve into the personal lives of rock music fans to discover that the alternative crowd really aren't that different! They get drunk, they have drama and they fail miserably at finding love just as much as anyone else.

When you're young it's all about the sex, partying and rock and roll but as you get older you learn that there are consequences to everything and hangovers really suck! The alternative crowd have always been met with dirty looks and stereotyped views, but no matter how outrageous they may dress they're just the same as everyone else. They fall in love and they fail in love, they have friendship drama and crappy jobs all the same. The series follows three flatmates and their tag along friend as they try desperately to find that one person they can be happy with whilst dealing with all the obstacles that come before them; social awkwardness, insecurity and a difficulty in letting go of the past.::Anonymous
